Troubleshooting

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Contents

  • 1 Building
    • 1.1 Q. PT fails to compile
  • 2 Running
    • 2.1 Q. PT fails to start, with a warning that it couldn't load one of the CrystalSpace plugins
    • 2.2 Q. PT crashes for you, but not for anyone else
    • 2.3 Q. Server crashes several dozen seconds after startup
    • 2.4 Q. Client crashes when trying to load a character

Building

Q. PT fails to compile

A. Since PT uses developmental versions of the CS and CEL libraries, the CS and CEL code may change regularly. So if there's a problem building PT, it can often be fixed by updating these two libraries to the latest versions.

To update, change to the directory with the proper library, and use: 

svn update

Don't forget to recompile the code after updating.

Running

Q. PT fails to start, with a warning that it couldn't load one of the CrystalSpace plugins

A. PT may not be able to find the directory which the CS libs are located. Try setting the CRYSTAL and CEL environment variables to point to the CS and CEL dirs, respectively, if you haven't already done so.

If you're using the sh or bash command shells, use the following syntax: 

export CRYSTAL=/path/to/your/cs/dir
export CEL=/path/to/your/cel/dir

If you're using the csh or tcsh command shells, use the following syntax: 

setenv CRYSTAL /path/to/your/cs/dir
setenv CEL /path/to/your/cel/dir

In either example, replace the pathname with the paths where you've installed CS/CEL.

Q. PT crashes for you, but not for anyone else

A. Sometimes after a updating code and rebuilding, stale dependencies may have been left around from a previous build. If you've already built PT in the past, try cleaning and rebuilding the code in the CS, CEL, and PT directories. Also, it may sometimes be necessary to re-run the configure again before attempting to re-build.

To clean stale code, use this command in the proper directory: 

jam clean

Q. Server crashes several dozen seconds after startup

A. The world database file that you're using may have become obsolete after updates to the server. Try deleting the file test_db.sqlite in the root dir. It will be automatically regenerated the next time that you run the server.

Q. Client crashes when trying to load a character

A. Before creating a character, it is necessary to invoke an Upload Server Data, or else the character will not load properly. This is a development feature, and will presumably go away in the future. From the character select menu, click Setup Server, then Upload Server Data, then Done. After that, you are free to create new characters.
